[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Digital Asset Management System (DAMS) defines functional and technical requirements for managing and sharing digital collections.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: DAMS supports uploads, metadata management, and controlled access to digital assets.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: DAMS integrates with Active Directory, library systems, and external APIs.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: DAMS provides web-based interfaces for repository and metadata management.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: DAMS operates on scalable cloud infrastructure.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: DAMS provides REST APIs for updates and metadata harvesting.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: DAMS ensures secure HTTPS-based data exchange.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: DAMS manages large digital collections with optimized resources.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: DAMS ensures 24/7 uptime with automated monitoring.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: DAMS links to repositories, indexing tools, and metadata aggregators.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: DAMS supports collection management, metadata updates, and access control.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: DAMS serves repository managers, library staff, and researchers.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: DAMS depends on network stability, integrations, and metadata quality.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: DAMS requires cloud infrastructure, metadata standards, and authentication services.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Collection: Group of related digital assets.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with Active Directory for authentication.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall support REST APIs for repository updates.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall enable metadata harvesting.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall support automated metadata propagation (REQ-DB-002).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall enforce role-based access (REQ-ATTR-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall link related objects within collections.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-005: The system shall track and log interactions for auditing (REQ-ATTR-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive, multilingual interface (REQ-DSGN-001).

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall update metadata within 5 seconds.
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support concurrent access without degradation (REQ-ATTR-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store metadata in a structured relational database.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall enable indexed metadata search.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with GDPR and archival preservation standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall encrypt data at rest and in transit.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to ISO 14721 for digital preservation.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall provide role-based access.
[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-002: The system shall ensure 99.9% uptime with failover.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Browsing, metadata updates, access control, and performance tests.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Metadata schemas, architecture diagrams, and API documentation.
[SEC] 5. References: GDPR, ISO 14721, and library metadata standards.
